properties.address: The Open Door, 3 Slade Hill,, Warwickshire, Warwickshire CV35 8SA
properties.description: Welcome to our community meeting hub! At the heart of our community lies a warm and welcoming space, The Open Door. More than just a place to savour delicious coffee and treats, it's a haven where fellowship and friendship blossom. Whether you're a long-standing member of our congregation or a newcomer seeking a moment of respite, our meeting hub is here to serve you. It's not just about the food and beverages; it's about the sense of belonging. The Open Door is a reflection of our commitment to nurturing a strong, loving community, where everyone is welcomed with open arms.
properties.title: The Open Door

properties.address: Bardsley House, Hill Top, Coventry, CV1 5EP CV1 5EP
properties.description: Bardsley Youth Project warm hub is open to all young people aged 16 to 25 and will be held every Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday from 1-4 pm, excluding the charities' christmas break from Friday 22nd Dec to January 2nd inclusive.. Young people can keep warm, charge their phones, get hot drinks, toast and soup, and access Bardsley’s other services such as 1:1 support outside of these times if needed. More substantial hot food is available Thursdays between 1-2pm. It varies each week. Based in Coventry City Centre, Bardsley Youth Project is a youth homelessness prevention and crisis relief charity. They support young people aged 16-25 who are concerned about their housing situation. If you need guidance, advice and support call 07943688760 Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm or visit www.bardsleyyouth.org. You can keep up to date with the latest news on Facebook and Instagram @BardsleyYouthProject

hours._text: Monday, Tuesday and Thursday 1-4pm - warm welcome; More substantial hot food Thursdays 1-2pm

Underground lights creative cafe - every Wednesdays (1:30 to 4:30pm) Choir with no name - every Wednesdays (6-9pm), community choir and food afterwards. Resting spaces - every Friday 10-3pm. A warm cosy space for people to rest while doing errands in the city centre. Cyrenians Christmas dinner - 25th December (12 - 4pm) Lunch. Christmas Panto - £1 charge Christmas Panto W/C 4th Dec , 4th,5th,7th,8th (8-9pm), 9th (4:30 - 5:30pm) Cosy Creatives 2 - This project will start in January. We are normally open as a community space offering warm welcome to people. Sometimes we don't have any specific events going on but people can just walk in to socialise. We have a new Art & Community Hub (ArCH) at the back of our building that will be opening soon.

properties.description: Informal Coffee Mornings - Tuesday and Thursday mornings 10am Luncheon Club - Thursday 12pm - Come along and enjoy a good, home-cooked lunch and meet new friends. Places are limited, so please contact the church office to put your name down on a list for lunch. “Move it or Lose It” Fitness Class - Friday 10 - 11am - £5 will get you an hour of senior-friendly exercise with a trained instructor. Please register at 9.30am the first time you attend. Tea Dance - Second Friday of each month 2 - 4pm - Come along to the main hall once a month and join a group of people who just like to dance. No pressure, no need to be skilled and no judges’ score cards! “Bounce & Play” Toddler Group - Wednesday mornings £5 per session - Contact the Church Office for dates - Bouncy Castles, Soft Play Area, Ball Pools & much more! Sing Your Heart Out” A dementia-friendly social group open to all who enjoy singing for fun, led by an experienced music teacher - Every 1st & 3rd Tuesday from 1.30 to 3pm

properties.title: Canley Library

properties.address: Deedmore Christian Centre, Deedmore Road, Wood End, Coventry CV2 2AA
properties.description: Foodbank The Eating Place (pay what you can) - with hot meals available from 12noon and drinks/pastries/cakes before that. Last orders are at 1.40pm Men's breakfast club Eldercare (community lunch for the elderly) - there is a suggested charge of £4 to cover the food. For more info about this please contact Carole carole@covcitymission.org.uk. Anyone who wants to attend the Eldercare lunch club, please let us know in advance for catering purposes. Building Blocks Stay & Play (term time only) - Drinks are available (but not food). People are welcome to bring a packed lunch if they would like to. On Thursdays we also have: Connect in the Café: This is an informal ‘service’ with some songs, activities and a very short bible-based talk, with drinks and cake/pastries available. 10am start, for around 40mins. Craft in the Café: a different craft activity is available each week, or people are welcome to bring their own e.g. crochet or pattern drawing pad. Sarah is around to chat and help with the activity (she’s also really good at crochet so often supports/teaches people.) This is from 11am until 12:30pm but anyone is welcome to continue with the activities in the café until it closes at 2pm.

hours._text: Mon 12.00pm-2.00pm (Lunch club for the elderly); Tues, Thurs & Fri 11.00am-2.00pm (Pay What You Can Cafe); Tues-Fri 11.30am-1.30pm (Foodbank); Wed 9.30-11.00am (Men's breakfast club); Wed 12.00pm-2.00pm (Stay & Play - term time only);

properties.title: Westbury Community Centre

properties.address: Cottage Square, Leamington Spa CV31 1PT
properties.description:
The Warm and Well Hub is run to support people with cost of living issues and to offer a regular, inclusive and welcoming social outlet for anyone feeling lonely or isolated in the community.

Free lunch and cost of living advice. Games for anyone not wanting to engage in the cost of living activity including short mat bowls, table tennis and board games. Guest speakers and activities.

Call 01926 422071 or email wellbeing@sydni.org to register (20 spaces weekly)

www.facebook.com/TheSydniCentre

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.
properties.title: Sydni Centre Warm and Well Hub

properties.address: Shire Hall, Warwick, CV34 4RL
properties.description:
Coffee Morning – Drop in for a free relaxed monthly coffee morning for adults, first Wednesday of every month. Occasional talks, free refreshments, and the opportunity to chat with old friends and new.

The library is open to all, Monday – Friday 8am – 5.30pm (5pm on Fridays) and Saturdays 9am – 4pm. It is a warm, safe space with access to free wifi and a range of activities and resources. It is free to join the library, and for library members to borrow books and use a computer or tablet on site.

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.
